metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3347 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in Samba's SMB2 packet signing mechanism. The SMB2 packet signing is not enforced if an admin configured "server signing = required" or for SMB2 connections to Domain Controllers where SMB2 packet signing is mandatory. This flaw allows an attacker to perform attacks, such as a man-in-the-middle attack, by intercepting the network traffic and modifying the SMB2 messages between client and server, affecting the integrity of the data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libldb2 - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
python3-ldb - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

ctdb - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
python3-samba - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
registry-tools - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-ad-dc - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-ad-provision - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-common - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-libs - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
smbclient - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
winbind - 2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.17.7+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
